text: Fay Weldon (born Franklin Birkinshaw; 22 September 1931 â€“ 4 January 2023) was a British author, essayist and playwright. Weldon's most known work is her novel The Life and Loves of a She-Devil (1983), which she wrote at the age of 52. Weldon was born in Birmingham. She lived in New Zealand until the age of 15. She was married three times and had four children. Weldon died on 4 January 2023, at the age of 91. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website Category:1931 births Category:2023 deaths Category:English playwrights Category:English novelists Category:English essayists Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire Category:Writers from Birmingham
title: Fay Weldon
